column4: hi, i want to install opera. i can't find it on the ubuntu repository. is it still there?
is it in medibuntu?
i use medibuntu, so i guess not
let me do a search then
how do you do such a search?
yes, i followed the guidelines there before i came here to ask. i'm still getting a "E: Package opera has no installation candidate"
after i update
did you add that repo
yup
please paste.ubuntu.com with your sources.list
http://paste.ubuntu.com/108181/
what are repos on line 54 and 55
that's a good question, let me check
i think i used them to install freemind
the version in the repos is not up to date
that is odd
there are two other options ; one is get the opera repo or get the 3rd party deb, both of which will break package management
sorry for the delay, i just got back. what do you mean it will break the package management if i install from the opera repo?
depending on outside sources is always a risk; the 3rd party deb is what I should have said
so you would rather d/l the specific deb than add the opera repo?
just a second I will try to install opera from repos
so the wiki is outdated as I cannot install from there either
so you can use opera repos or get the deb
ok, thanks. i'll go with the opera repos.
